title:
$\eta$-Ricci solitons and $\eta$-Einstein metrics on weak
  $\beta$-Kenmotsu $f$-manifolds
abstract:
The study is motivated by the interest in metric $f$-contact geometry and
Ricci-type solitons in theoretical physics and geometry. Weak $f$-structures on
a smooth manifold $M^{2n+s}\ (s>1)$ have been introduced by V. Rovenski and R.
Wolak as a generalization of $f$-structures by K. Yano. In this paper, we
introduce new structures of this kind called weak $\beta$-Kenmotsu
$f$-structures as a generalization of the concept by K. Kenmotsu (and its
extensions by other geometers) and explore their properties and geometrical
interpretations. The paper demonstrates that a weak $\beta$-Kenmotsu
$f$-manifold is locally a twisted/warped product of $\mathbb{R}^s$ and a weak
K\"{a}hlerian manifold. It also shows that such manifolds with constant $\beta$
and an $\eta$-Ricci soliton structure have constant scalar curvature and can be
$\eta$-Einstein manifolds.
